name: Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort

reviews.text: Excellent location and service at this hotel. The gentlemen at the valet stand tried to help us get our rental car convertible down - must have been broken - we had 3-4 guys helping us out! The doorman gave excellent suggestions for a drive down PCH. The front desk was o.k., but the others were great! I needed towels for the pool area at night, and they got them right away.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was clean and open, and the bed was wonderful!
reviews.title: Fifty-fifty

reviews.text: One complaint is that the turn-down service showed up after 8 pm. Sorry, when you come in from the East Coast that is a little late for turn-down.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, bad location

likes.disliked: — Terrible location/on noisy hwy, major construction nearby

reviews.text: The location and the general property are all nice, what you'd expect from a Hilton, although things look a little dated, but overall good. Bar and bar service were great at the restaurant. The room was very nice as well. Shower could have had better water pressure, I know it's nitty, but c'mon, I have certain expectations when staying at a Hilton. My real complaints are that in today's technological age, and at the price of this hotel, I'd expect wireless internet service to be free, but alas, at this hotel, it's something like $9.95 just to connect. Pretty much every thing is nickel and dimed here, i.e., don't move the beer in the stocked fridge to see what's behind it, it'll cost you the price of the beer ($9) just for moving it. Yep. Also, don't put any bottled water in the fridge, it'll cost $40 for the privilege of storing it in there. It's all motion sensored and the little elves at the front desk wait and watch. Also, bicycles are $12 per hour for rental, so if you're out for a few hours with a friend, you could've bought a new bike. Overall our stay was good, but a little surprised by the pettiness of the hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

likes.liked: — The room, the view, the loaction, the hotel, the pool, the brunch bufffet

reviews.text: Beautiful beach view ("Surf City") overlooking busy and noisy Pacific Coast Hwy. Noisy construction next door (pile driver starts at 7 AM), smelly powerplant down the road. Inside the facilities are beautiful but small touches are missing: no nightlight in the bathroom, chairs and table on balcony covered with grit, no ventilation in bathroom, slippery tub, no food service at the pool. Food was adequate to good, service was excellent, especially consierge.
reviews.title: Great Service, Great Place to Relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the third time I've stayed at a Hilton. The first time (Pittsfield, Massachussetts) was good, but my last stay (Niagra Falls, Canada) and this one (Huntington Beach) proves that Hilton is merely living off its' name. The property in Huntington Beach is old but has recently been remodeled. However, it is not what I call "upgraded". The hotel was clean as was the room. Yet, the room was small with two very "uncomfortable "double" beds that were actually more like twins. The pool was warm but a little dirty (cloudy water and sandy). The Jacuzzi was small, old, and it need of repair. It too was not the cleanest. At $300 a day, I expected much more. And on top of it, you get socked for $25.00 a day (plus tips) for valet parking. What a total rip off! Also, avoid Shades the hotel restaurant. It costs a fortune to eat, and the service is horrible. Our waiter disappeared several times and it took forever to get the check.The bar is'nt much better either. A Coors light and a mixed drink cost $14.00 plus tip. Try Main Street or Beach Street for better eateries at better prices. The nicest thing about this hotel was the view from our balconey over looking the beach. However,this place is not worth the money! If you're going to spend a fortune, try the Hyatt Resort next door...it's got to be a better value.
reviews.title: Over priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a suite with a king sized bed and it was pure luxury! I felt like a queen sleeping at the Hilton! The service the staff provided was great. They made sure we were comfortable and kept my mini bar restocked. The pool was heated and the scenery was exotic. Very well done. This hotel is top notch and I've stayed at my fair share of hotels. Will recommend to my friends. Thanks for everything!
reviews.title: In Love With The Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel. Our room included a beach view and had a balcony. Luckily we didn't have a beach view on the side of the hotel where a major construction project is just underway. The furnishings in the room were also beautiful.......except: even though the bathroom sink with granite top was lovely, it was too large for an average size woman (5'4") to comfortably use. The height was fine, but the 6" of granite in front of the sink made it impossible to use without making alot of splashing mess. We were very unhappy that our room was not cleaned at a reasonable hour. By 1:30 pm, I called the front desk to ask that it be cleaned. When we returned to the room at 4:00 - it still had not been done. I had to call again. Finally the maid arrived - and in a quick 5-10 minutes she was done. This is unsatisfactory! Other than a beach type snack bar across the Pacific Coast Highway there are no restaurants within a comfortable walking distance. The hotel restaurants were extremely pricey. We were glad we had rented a car.
reviews.title: Below average in a beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to the Waterfront on our 10 year anniversary. Paid $235/night, stayed 2 nights. The hotel is described as a resort but there is no day spa at the site. It had one restaurant and bar. Pool and fitness room is smaller than pictured on the website. The decor of the hotel and rooms are beautiful. 42" LCD with HD programming in the room. Staff is very friendly. Brunch on Sundays at $38pp but NO crab legs. There was not much to do at the hotel itself. However, the location was right across from the beach and about a 1/4 mile from the main strip of Huntington Beach and the pier. The views from the room balacony was great. We had a "sunrise view" room. Note that with the sunrise view, you also see the smoke stacks from a near-by refinery. To the north of the hotel, aka "sunset view" (as of May 2007) has some major construction going on. Did not experience a lot of noise but not much to look at. Parking at the hotel is $22 (valet only). Suprisingly, the gift shop has great bargains. Cheaper than the nearby tourist shops. Also, the closer a restaurant is to the water the more expensive. Walk down a bit away from the beach and price will drop. Food much better too. Overall, had a great time and would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great views! Not much to do at the hotel.

likes.disliked: — Not much to do at the hotel.

reviews.text: I brought my Mom, for her 88th birthday, to this lovely resort. The resort is right on Pacific Coast Hwy and we could see the ocean, which was a real treat for her (we had a handicapped room with a sunrise/ocean view). When I called a week ahead, I had asked if some special things be done to the room to accomodate her.... which they said they would be able to do.
reviews.title: Lovely Property!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 days for a portion of our honeymoon. The service and people were really friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great service/people! But...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The housekeeping did a great job cleaning the room. Always smelled fresh/clean.
reviews.title: A great experience!

reviews.text: We bought a few DVDs from Disney and we never had a DVD player in our room. We called and they installed it for us no charge whatsoever.
reviews.title: Rip Off Ocean View Room - Looked over the huge construction site.

reviews.text: We've stayed here on and off over the past 16 years, but haven't been in about 5 years or so. We had reservations at both this Hilton and the new Hyatt Huntington Beach. We were down in the area two weeks before, and decided to check them out before making our decision. The Hyatt is beautiful, but overwhelmingly huge. When we walked into the lobby of the Hilton, it was like coming into a small inn, in comparison. For about the same rate, we chose the Hilton, and had a beautiful oceanfront room with endless views of up and down the coast. The hotel has been renovated over the years, and our room was just lovely for the four of us. The staff was friendly, and the valet was quick. We only had drinks at Shades, and while my cosmo was yummy, it was the smallest martini I had ever seen, and for the highest price! We will definitely go back here again.
reviews.title: Perfect end of summer family trip

reviews.text: I just returned from a 3 night/4 day stay at the Hilton in Huntington Beach... we had a large party (4 adults and 6 kids), and everyone had a great time!! The staff was top notch- helpful, friendly, willing to go the extra mile (and I'm a customer service snob!). They even sent someone from engineering up to my room to hook up a complimentary DVD player for our kids!! The guys in valet were quick with the cars, and always had a smile and a restaurant recommendation. The beds were HEAVEN. What a great way to rest after a day of body surfing. The location is divine! We walked to the beach, the pier, Main Street... and we aren't in tip top shape. On the downside, we had dinner in the Shades restaurant one night, and I would never go there again. The waitress was deficient, distant, and rude, and our food took 40 minutes to arrive after we ordered it (and the restaurant was NOT busy). In addition, the menu is limited and quite overpriced. Also, for a resort property, I think the $9.95 wireless internet fee is petty. They should just include the service as many top hotels do now. Above all, we had a beautiful beach view, relaxing balcony overlooking the pool, fabulous beds, and great service. I shared the room with a friend and spent just over $400 total for 3 nights.
reviews.title: Already considering rebooking for next year

likes.liked: — beach acces, excellent staff, great beds
likes.disliked: — Shades restaurant was overpriced and had bad service

reviews.text: Me and my family went to the Hilton Huntington Beach in July,and it was a great hotel. The rooms were great, they each have a flat screen tv and a balcony. The beds were extremely comfortable. We were on the 11th floor and had a beautiful view of the ocean. The pool area was also very nice and the pool was very warm. It was also in a very convenient location right off the Pacific Coast Highway. It is a short distance to the other beach towns. Everyday we would also walk to Main Street to grad a bite to eat, it was a short walk. We had a great time in Huntington Beach.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel with Great Ocean Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When going for a stay in my home town, we thought that this time around we would spend a little more to stay directly at the beach, rather than a few miles away. From the pictures, the Hilton looked like a beautiful place to stay with lots of amenities. I even called to make sure things would be as they seemed. I have two words for our stay at this hotel---BIG MISTAKE!
reviews.title: Definitely NOT worth the price!!

likes.disliked: — horrible staff, poor guest treatment, not worth the price, required to sign no early checkout

reviews.text: Upon arrival, the only glitch with that was, that my room key would not work and I made 3 trips back to the front desk. Due to this inconvience, the hotel manager went up with me to make sure I didn't have this same problem again. When I mentioned the special needs that I had, he got right on it and everything was taken care of. He kindly gave me my $30 fridge (the fee for a fridge in the room) at no charge for my trouble with the key and had an engineer, at my request called up immediately, to take care of all of the items - all in preparation for my mom's arrival. He also made himself available to us for the duration of our stay, should we have needed anything else. The room was a tad bit smaller than I had hoped for, but it was fine and had all the ammenities. I felt the customer service was excellent and I have traveled much in my lifetime, so I can attest to this fact. The room was decorated very nicely.
reviews.title: Fair and Balanced Review

likes.disliked: — front desk and valet staff attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend using Hilton points. We had a room on the 9th floor which appeared to have been recently renovated. It was all new with an LCD TV. We had a balcony with a great view of the beach and ocean. Note that the hotel is across the street from the beach, so there was a fair amount of traffic noise, but the view was great. All rooms appear to have a balcony with an ocean view. Our room was the farthest back from the beach, so as long as your up a few floors, even the worst view is awesome.
reviews.title: Great views of the beach!

likes.liked: — Location! Right across the street from the beach.

reviews.text: We stayed on the "sunrise" side of the hotel on the recommendation of the front desk clerk. She told us about the construction on the "sunset" side of the hotel. So even though the "sunset" side had a view of the pier and the sunset, immediately adjacent to the hotel is a large construction project. There was no noise while we were there, but it is a bit of an eyesore and I would expect a fair amount of noise during the week.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, Great Service
Not bad, but way too pricey
reviews.text: Our only complaint about the room was noise from the hallway and adjoining room. We were near the elevator and could hear talking from the hallway very clearly inside our room well into the night. There is no sound proofing between the room and hall. And very little between the adjoining rooms. Make sure to request a room far from the elevators.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The common areas, including the pool, were very nice. But don't expect an expansive Hawaii-type resort. It's really just a very nice hotel in a great location.
reviews.title: Don't Bother!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner in the hotel restaurant - Spades. The food was incredible - probably the best filet mignon I've ever tasted. And the swordfish was excellent, as well. There's no need to leave the hotel for a great meal.
reviews.title: Okay hotel - Too much money for what you get

likes.disliked: — Cold showers, no self Park, expensive for what you get

reviews.text: The Not so Good: The wait to check in was longer than expected. They failed to notify me when my room was ready after they said they would call. To top it off, no apologies were offered for forgetting to call me - they acted like they didn't care and it wasn’t their mistake. Also the valet did not offer to get a bell man to help w/ the luggage when I stated that I had luggage. Instead he started to drive away with my car while I was still trying to unload my trunk – dangerous! The towels and bath mats are dingy and frayed. The bath tub did not drain well – was backed up. Overall, I repeatedly experienced an apathetic attitude on behalf of the front desk and valet area. They did not think and act proactively to exceed customer expectations - so do not expected it, especially if you are traveling for pleasure or a special occasion such as a wedding or anniversary. If they were proactive, the tub would have been draining well, the frayed towels would have been retired, they would apologize at the front desk when they are at fault, and they would have identified the need for a bell man. It is also not one of the prettier beach neighborhoods in the US or even in California. Also there was no coffee vendor (from what I could find) in or near the hotel and the nearest Starbucks was 0.5 miles away!
reviews.title: Enjoyed are overnite stay

likes.liked: — the sunrise view, rooms are beautiful
likes.disliked: — slightly cool weather during are stay

reviews.title: Some updated info...
reviews.text: Bottomline: If you are planning to have a wedding, honeymoon or an important memorable event here, keep looking around at other places and locations. You will most likely be able to get more value for your money elsewhere in a more scenic and pristine neighborhood.

reviews.title: Great conference location
reviews.text: I use to live is southern california during my teenage years and early twenty's. Now I live in upstate NY and love going back to Calif. to visit. We decided to stay one nite by the beach before going to our next destination for our family vacation. I choose this hotel because it was soo close the the beach. I use to hang out in newport beach all the time, but I was not familiar with Huntington Beach. So I decided to give it a try. This hotel or the room should I say was beautiful. Nice decor. I was told by the bellman that they just renovated all the rooms. They did an excellent job. I chose a sunrise view because it faces newport beach and I wanted to reminisce. In my opion its a better view than the sunset view. The balcony was nice to hang out and have a glass of wine in the afternoon. The beds where very comfortable. I didn't get to use the hotel much since it was such a short stay so I really have no opinion. So what that you have to pay for parking. Those are the things I over look.

aka: Hilton Waterfront Beach Hotel Huntington Beach
description: The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel is located on the picturesque coastline of Southern California, in the heart of Surf City USA™ in Huntington Beach, California. Book a room or oceanview suite and enjoy proximity to Disneyland(R) Resort, Knott's Berry Farm and the Aquarium of the Pacific. Join us for lunch or dinner at the famous Shades Restaurant.
